tweets.text: Upside target alarms for short-term trades or short entry wishes going off en masse.

Yes, the next phase is people embarrassed to own a Tesla. 

Thank goodness Musk sold more $s of stock than the company will ever make. https://t.co/1YPQ1mjItX

Northern Colorado and southern Wyoming. 

#southwestcancellationadventures https://t.co/jyoaRiWD9w

$GRPN a donut?

Big chunk of cash is really float fronted by customers that $GRPN waits to pay out to merchants that provide the services on site. As volumes dry up, that float disappears.

Cash flows brutal. Now in a net debt position vs. net cash for most of history.
#i'mshort https://t.co/H2iD4KYAIF

Carvana:  Let's go take market share in the loss-leader portion of the business and have little to nothing to do with the long-tail high margin annuity portion of the business.  

#realmenofgenius

Fact of the matter is that selling cars has never really been that great of a business.

Now, servicing cars you've sold?

There's gold in dem hills.

There was an account on here mocking others for not taking him up on a personal bet on Carvana Restructuring happening in 2022. Offered bet up again for 2023 but reduced duration to 6 months.  That was only 2 days ago.

Tough game. Stay humble.

Narrator: Good Night Moon
Carvana: Good Night
I do/do not own a Tesla vehicle and would buy an Apple Car or another Tesla Car, if Apple Car comes out in 2026.
